channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's legal team turns over docs related to NYT story, requests they be sealed
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Lawyers claimed there was a "need to avoid" the public dissemination of documents Sam Bankman-Fried had shown a New York Times reporter which led to a story on Caroline Ellison.

item.title: BTC price shrugs off strong PCE data as Bitcoin traders eye $28K range
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin traders expect downside as BTC price offers a muted reaction to the Fed's "preferred" inflation metric.

item.title: 6 Questions for Simon Davis of Mighty Bear Games
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Mighty Bear Games CEO Simon Davis — AKA “Papa Bear” — gave us a look inside his Web3 gaming studio, and his thoughts on the future of gaming.

item.title: French privacy watchdog questions Worldcoin’s data collection method: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: French data protection agency CNIL said it finds the legality of Worldcoin’s collection methods “questionable” alongside the conditions for storing the data.

item.title: Blockchain technology lets East African farmers sell globally
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Andrew Singer
item.description: Blockchains’ tracing capacities can help certify that crops weren’t grown by razing woodlands or harvested with child labor.

item.title: Is 2023 the year we’re able to take control of our data?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arie Trouw
item.description: Given the importance of sovereignty and data today, it is not possible for people to be fully sovereign without entrusting sovereignty over their own data.

item.title: Indian Supreme Court raps Union government on crypto rules delay: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The Supreme Court bench asked the union government to file a report on whether the latter is capable of setting up a federal agency to investigate crypto-related crimes.

item.title: The Agenda podcast chats with Energy Web on how to fight climate change with the help of blockchain
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ray Salmond
item.description: Energy Web CEO Jesse Morris explains why blockchain can make “going green” more efficient, how fighting climate change is easier, and why Energy Web is building on Polkadot.

item.title: Here’s how big food and beverage brands are using NFTs: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The key supporting factors for the market are the adoption of blockchain technology and the demand for NFTs for transparency and traceability in the food industry.

item.title: US Senate approves national defense bill that also targets crypto mixers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: An amendment in the bill tightens oversight on institutions engaging in crypto trading.

item.title: What is simulation theory? The savage illusion of living in a computer simulation
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: Simulation theory proposes that our reality is a sophisticated computer simulation, raising profound questions about the nature of consciousness and existence.

item.title: Hydropowered crypto mining gets nod from Kyrgyz president: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Kyrgyz President Sadyr Japarov promised to distribute money from crypto mining at the hydropower plant to “ordinary people.”

item.title: The Sandbox and the British Museum bring art and history to the metaverse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The partnership between The Sandbox, the British Museum and laCollection intends to make artifacts in the museum’s collection more accessible.

item.title: Japanese Web3 developer HashPort Group raises $8.5M in funding round
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The funds will be used to aid the firm's global expansion across tough regulatory landscapes.

item.title: Crypto mining hardware retailer Phoenix Technology mulls IPO in UAE: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: A mainstream media report highlighted that the mining hardware firm Phoenix Technology is planning to go public in Abu Dhabi, UAE.

item.title: Twitter Community Notes hits 44 countries as Elon Musk seeks ‘truth’ for X
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Contributors from 44 countries are tasked with vetting the information being shared on posts that draw greater attention and are often subject to being picked up by mainstream media.

item.title: NFT-styled debit cards the future of Web3 — Animoca founder on $30M Hi investment
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Animoca Brands partners with Hi, a Web3 neobanking app that features cryptocurrency exchange services, conventional digital banking and customized NFT-styled debit cards.

item.title: Crypto.com registers in the Netherlands, cleared to advertise services
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: The exchange received the green light from De Nederlandsche Bank to offer services in the country.

item.title: Binance, CZ challenge CFTC lawsuit, seek dismissal
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: Binance said that the CFTC is attempting to regulate foreign individuals and corporations operating outside the United States, going beyond the limits of its statutory jurisdiction.

item.title: Elon’s ‘not afraid of blowing things up’ — ex-Twitter exec on working under Musk
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Esther Crawford claimed Elon Musk’s inability to handle criticism created a “zealous and fanatical” inner circle.

item.title: FTX, Genesis reach in-principle agreement to settle bankruptcy case
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: FTX and Genesis lawyers have sent a letter to the bankruptcy judge regarding a settlement agreement.

item.title: Missing crypto millionaire found dismembered in suitcase: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Fernando Pérez Algaba reportedly ran a crypto trading business in Argentina and is suspected to have been murdered by a professional outfit.

item.title: SEC adopts cyberattack disclosure rules, listed crypto firms included
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Coinbase, Marathon Digital and Riot Blockchain are among the Securities and Exchange Commission-registered cryptocurrency firms that would need to comply with the rules.

item.title: AI researchers say they’ve found a way to jailbreak Bard and ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Artificial intelligence researchers claim to have found an automated, easy way to construct adversarial attacks on large language models.

item.title: ‘Historic week’ as stablecoin, self-custody bills advance to House floor
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The bills aim to create a regulatory framework for payment stablecoins and enshrine rights for crypto users to self-custody digital assets.

item.title: Pro-XRP lawyer Jeremy Hogan’s scam tweet bonanza finally falls silent
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: For the better part of the last four days, hackers used Hogan’s account to promote fraudulent XRP giveaway scams.

item.title: Grayscale urges SEC to approve all Bitcoin ETFs simultaneously
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Grayscale’s ETF was previously knocked back by the Securities and Exchange Commission; now the fund manager wants it and competing ETFs approved together so none have an advantage.

item.title: Sequoia slashes its crypto fund by 66% after industry collapses: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The $85 billion venture capital firm launched the Sequoia Crypto Fund in February 2022.

item.title: Bitcoin traders put eyes on $31K even as $2B in BTC options expire on Friday
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: BTC traders fix their eyes on $31,000 even as $2 billion in Bitcoin options are set to expire on July 28.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serge Egon Ostman
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting the Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.
